verses.verse: Then sang<WH7891> Deborah<WH1683> and Barak<WH1301> the son<WH1121> of Abinoam<WH42> on that day,<WH3117> saying,<WH559>
Praise<WH1288> you the LORD<WH3068> for the avenging<WH6544> <WH6546> of Israel,<WH3478> when the people<WH5971> willingly<WH5068> offered themselves.

Hear,<WH8085> O you kings;<WH4428> give ear,<WH238> O you princes;<WH7336> I, even I, will sing<WH7891> to the LORD;<WH3068> I will sing<WH2167> praise to the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel.<WH3478>

LORD,<WH3068> when you went<WH3318> out of Seir,<WH8165> when you marched<WH6805> out of the field<WH7704> of Edom,<WH123> the earth<WH776> trembled,<WH7493> and the heavens<WH8064> dropped,<WH5197> the clouds<WH5645> also<WH1571> dropped<WH5197> water.<WH4325>
The mountains<WH2022> melted<WH5140> from before<WH6440> the LORD,<WH3068> even that Sinai<WH5514> from before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel.<WH3478>

In the days<WH3117> of Shamgar<WH8044> the son<WH1121> of Anath,<WH6067> in the days<WH3117> of Jael,<WH3278> the highways<WH734> were unoccupied,<WH2308> and the travelers<WH1980> <WH5410> walked<WH3212> through byways.<WH734> <WH6128>

The inhabitants of the villages<WH6520> ceased,<WH2308> they ceased<WH2308> in Israel,<WH3478> until<WH5704> that I Deborah<WH1683> arose,<WH6965> that I arose<WH6965> a mother<WH517> in Israel.<WH3478>

They chose<WH977> new<WH2319> gods;<WH430> then<WH227> was war<WH3901> in the gates:<WH8179> was there a shield<WH4043> or spear<WH7420> seen<WH7200> among forty<WH705> thousand<WH505> in Israel?<WH3478>
My heart<WH3820> is toward the governors<WH2710> of Israel,<WH3478> that offered themselves willingly<WH5068> among the people.<WH5971> Bless<WH1288> you the LORD.<WH3068>
Speak,<WH7878> you that ride<WH7392> on white<WH6715> asses,<WH860> you that sit<WH3427> in judgment,<WH4055> and walk<WH1980> by the way.<WH1870>

They that are delivered from the noise<WH6963> of archers<WH2686> in the places of drawing<WH4857> water, there shall they rehearse<WH8567> the righteous<WH6666> acts of the LORD,<WH3068> even the righteous<WH6666> acts toward the inhabitants of his villages<WH6520> in Israel:<WH3478> then shall the people<WH5971> of the LORD<WH3068> go<WH3381> down<WH3381> to the gates.<WH8179>

Awake,<WH5782> awake,<WH5782> Deborah:<WH1683> awake,<WH5782> awake,<WH5782> utter<WH1696> a song:<WH7892> arise,<WH6965> Barak,<WH1301> and lead your captivity<WH7628> captive,<WH7617> you son<WH1121> of Abinoam.<WH42>
Then<WH227> he made him that remains<WH8300> have dominion<WH7287> over the nobles<WH117> among the people:<WH5971> the LORD<WH3068> made me have dominion<WH7287> over the mighty.<WH1368>

Out of Ephraim<WH669> was there a root<WH8328> of them against Amalek;<WH6002> after<WH310> you, Benjamin,<WH1144> among your people;<WH5971> out of Machir<WH4353> came<WH3381> down<WH3381> governors,<WH2710> and out of Zebulun<WH2074> they that handle<WH4900> the pen<WH7626> of the writer.<WH5608>

And the princes<WH8269> of Issachar<WH3485> were with Deborah;<WH1683> even Issachar,<WH3485> and also<WH3651> Barak:<WH1301> he was sent<WH7971> on foot<WH7272> into the valley.<WH6010> For the divisions<WH6391> of Reuben<WH7205> there were great<WH1419> thoughts<WH2711> of heart.<WH3820>

Why<WH4100> stayed<WH3427> you among<WH996> the sheepfolds,<WH4942> to hear<WH8085> the bleatings<WH8292> of the flocks?<WH5739> For the divisions<WH6391> of Reuben<WH7205> there were great<WH1419> searchings<WH2714> of heart.<WH3820>

Gilead<WH1568> stayed<WH7931> beyond<WH5676> Jordan:<WH3383> and why<WH4100> did Dan<WH1835> remain<WH1481> in ships?<WH591> Asher<WH836> continued<WH3427> on the sea<WH3220> shore,<WH2348> and stayed<WH7931> in his breaches.<WH4664>
Zebulun<WH2074> and Naphtali<WH5321> were a people<WH5971> that risked<WH2778> their lives<WH5315> to the death<WH4191> in the high<WH4791> places of the field.<WH7704>

The kings<WH4428> came<WH935> and fought,<WH3898> then<WH227> fought<WH3898> the kings<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667> in Taanach<WH8590> by the waters<WH4325> of Megiddo;<WH4023> they took<WH3947> no<WH3808> gain<WH1214> of money.<WH3701>
They fought<WH3898> from heaven;<WH8064> the stars<WH3556> in their courses<WH4546> fought<WH3898> against<WH5973> Sisera.<WH5516>
The river<WH5158> of Kishon<WH7028> swept<WH1640> them away, that ancient<WH6917> river,<WH5158> the river<WH5158> Kishon.<WH7028> O my soul,<WH5315> you have trodden<WH1869> down strength.<WH5797>
Then<WH227> were the horse hoofs<WH6119> <WH5483> broken<WH1986> by the means of the prancings,<WH1726> the prancings<WH1726> of their mighty<WH47> ones.

Curse<WH779> you Meroz,<WH4789> said<WH559> the angel<WH4397> of the LORD,<WH3068> curse<WH779> you bitterly<WH779> the inhabitants<WH3427> thereof; because<WH3588> they came<WH935> not to the help<WH5833> of the LORD,<WH3068> to the help<WH5833> of the LORD<WH3068> against the mighty.<WH1368>
Blessed<WH1288> above women<WH802> shall Jael<WH3278> the wife<WH802> of Heber<WH2268> the Kenite<WH7017> be, blessed<WH1288> shall she be above women<WH802> in the tent.<WH168>
He asked<WH7592> water,<WH4325> and she gave<WH5414> him milk;<WH2461> she brought<WH7126> forth<WH7126> butter<WH2529> in a lordly<WH117> dish.<WH5602>

She put<WH7971> her hand<WH3027> to the nail,<WH3489> and her right<WH3225> hand<WH3225> to the workmen's<WH6001> hammer;<WH1989> and with the hammer she smote<WH1986> Sisera,<WH5516> she smote<WH4277> off his head,<WH7218> when she had pierced<WH4272> and stricken<WH2498> through his temples.<WH7541>

At<WH996> her feet<WH7272> he bowed,<WH3766> he fell,<WH5307> he lay<WH7901> down:<WH7901> at<WH996> her feet<WH7272> he bowed,<WH3766> he fell:<WH5307> where<WH834> he bowed,<WH3766> there<WH8033> he fell<WH5307> down dead.<WH7703>

The mother<WH517> of Sisera<WH5516> looked<WH8259> out at<WH1157> a window,<WH2474> and cried<WH2980> through<WH1157> the lattice,<WH822> Why<WH4069> is his chariot<WH7393> so long<WH954> in coming?<WH935> why<WH4069> tarry<WH309> the wheels<WH6471> of his chariots?<WH4818>
Her wise<WH2450> ladies<WH8282> answered<WH6030> her, yes,<WH637> she returned<WH7725> answer<WH559> to herself,

Have they not sped?<WH4672> have they not divided<WH2505> the prey;<WH7998> to every<WH7218> man<WH1397> a damsel<WH7356> or two; to Sisera<WH5516> a prey<WH7998> of divers<WH6648> colors,<WH6648> a prey<WH7998> of divers<WH6648> colors<WH6648> of needlework,<WH7553> of divers<WH6648> colors<WH6648> of needlework<WH7553> on both sides, meet for the necks<WH6677> of them that take the spoil?<WH7998>

So<WH3651> let all<WH3605> your enemies<WH341> perish,<WH6> O LORD:<WH3068> but let them that love<WH157> him be as the sun<WH8121> when he goes<WH3318> forth<WH3318> in his might.<WH1369> And the land<WH776> had rest<WH8252> forty<WH705> years.<WH8141>
